result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Israel Salas Mercado

records.addlTxt: Confirmation of Interpreter
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Warrant Paperwork Returned from the Sheriff's Dept.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand List and Motion for Discovery. Filed by Atty Lopez.
Notice of Appointment. Amaro Lopez.
Defendant appeared LATE (Warrant should not have been signed)
Atty Amaro Lopez appointed
Defendant appear late - bond no longer forfeited

4:00 PM Defendant David Israel Salas Mercado in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Enrique Soria is sworn in and interprets for court.
Prior warrant and costs assessed and forfeit of bond are quashed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Surety bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

2:49 PM Defendant David Israel Salas Mercado not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $1,000  cash alternative - Statewide  -  vacated
Costs for Interpreter will be assessed to the defendant.. - vacated
Confirmation of Interpreter
Initial Appearance set for 09/19/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 2
No contact with the Walmart in Plover

1:06 PM Defendant David Salas Mercado and Jhoan Villanueba Rendon in court and in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of WI. Cases are called together.  Interpreter Susan Rascon is sworn in and interprets for the court and defendants.
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Susan appears on behalf of the defendant.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Retail Theft for Villanueba and Party to Retail Theft for Salas Mercado. 
Attorney for the defendants statements about the facts of the case are heard by the court.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendants committed it.

Court informs defendants of the right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendants are  eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated for each defendant.
Attorney for the defendants does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
